Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very good value and great position”
Reviews.Author: JM2957
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Vaparetto stop, so very convenient for sightseeing. It has a small bar and there are a couple of good, reasonably priced restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel is like a tardis! Modern, clean and comfortable - very friendly English-speaking staff. Attractive breakfast room serving a more than adequate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A pristine modern masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: Charlene_of_KY
Reviews.Content: I don't know how they managed to accomplish this, but it appears that they have gutted a very old Venetian building and turned the inside into a modern hotel, with all of the amenities. This is our first time staying in a hotel that wasn't in "Venice proper." Water buses were a little tricky out here to Giudecca at first (having been to Venice several times before we thought we could "improvise" with the water buses, bad idea), but once you know the right buses to take, it is easy. Unlike the main island of Venice, where all the touristy stuff is, Giudecca is a neighborhood with real people, the locals who grew up in and live in Venice. And it is so quiet here, unlke the main island. We were there for three days and nights and the only thing I heard outside our window was a boat going by, and only that one time. Air conditioning was a godsend, plumbing was great, lots of hot water, but it took a few minutes to come up. The shower stall was tiny, so large folks may have a problem. The hotel has an elevator, simply unheard of in small hotels in Venice, so this is great for luggage and for people who are physically challenged. The breakfast was awesome, lots of things to chose from. I am a tea drinker, and I only had to order my breakfast tea once, and the lady managing the breakfast room remembered that and remembered me and, bless her heart, she had my tea piping hot, on my table almost before I sat down. She must surely be a mind reader! People didn't much like the coffee machine in the breakfast room, from what I could overhear from the other guests. My tea, though, was delicious and perfect each morning. I would make a trip back to Venice just to stay in this hotel. I very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Derby17
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very modern and contemporary in design. Staff were friendly and helpful with excellent English. Breakfast had a good choice of quality ingredients and overall was very good. Room was small but very clean and functional, shower was powerful with ready supply of piping hot water. Free wifi is a nice touch, with reception just about making it to the room. Giudecca is an excellent place to stay in Venice, away from the hustle and bustle of the main island, but with very frequent 24hr vaparetto service to all parts of Venice and the wider lagoon. Overall this hotel represents great value for the location and I would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tony P
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and a friend have just returned from a 3 day stay at the Domina Home hotel in Venice. My wife had stayed there some 8 years ago and recommended it and now I can endorse that view. It is far and away the best 3 star hotel I have stayed in. The rooms are modern, well designed and well maintained and the staff excellent; genuinely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is continental (cereal, croissants, fruit, ham coffee etc) rather than cooked. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are several within 10 minutes walk. If you haven't been to Venice before, don't be put off by the fact that the Domina Home is not on the main island's of the town's centre. In fact, it's location on Giudecca is an advantage as we found it very quiet with restaurants nearby that are a little cheaper (and more honest) than those in the centre. You can reach the hotel easily from Marco Polo airport by Blue Line waterbus to Zattere then take the Line 2 east bound to Palanca (about 3 minutes across the canal). The Domina Home is about 5 minutes walk (left from the waterbus stop, over the bridge, 1st or 2nd right down the narrow alley).

Reviews.Title: “Iâ€™m sorry but I cannot recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peder M
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m sorry but I cannot recommend this hotel. The free internet was not available in our room. We informed the staff in the lobby but they could not help us. We ask them kindly to solve the problem but nothing happened. The next morning we kindly ask them again to do something to get the internet up running again. When we returned the following evening we still not got any internet and we contacted the staff in the lobby again but the guy in the lobby was very unfriendly and told us we could sit in an office next to the lobby or use the WI-FI in the lobby and that was it. We called Hotel.com and informed them about our problem. They could not help us and told us that it was not their responsibility if the hotel not could give us what we had paid for. But Hotel.com called the hotel and informed them that we have problems with the internet. After that conversation with Hotel.com the hotel try to fix the internet but they could not fix it and told us that it was now late Friday evening and a technician first could be called after the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tai-land
Reviews.Content: This was probably our favorite hotel in Italy because of the value. You get more bang for your buck here and the hotel is more modern and clean than many of the other hotels in Italy. Also, it is more quiet on this island than in Venice so that is a plus for us. Bathroom is decent size with a canal view. There is free wifi in the lobby, but be sure to bring your ethernet cord since you can connect to the internet on a hard wire in your room. Although not on the main island, we did not mind it at all since it was easy going back and forth to the main island and the water buses run pretty much all day/night (even at 2am). Be sure to purchase the water bus passes since you will use it often and even for the airport departure. The staff was also friendly. There is the guy who works the night shift(forget his name, but he has long hair). He was supercool, helpful and went out of his way to look up the water bus/airport bus schedule in the early am since we had a 6:50am flight out of venice. Thanks to him we saved a bunch of money since he pulled schedules online for us. Breakfast was just ok. Basic continental breakfast. The lady who served us good have smiled more. Here is a tip: if you don't like the cappacino in the breakfast room, you can request it from the front desk which has a better cappacino machine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Chambers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Giudecca Island, not on the main Island of Venice. The location is very good, you aren't right in the thick of things, but you're still close the the main Island, and it's very easy to get around on the vaparetto boats. The room was a very good size, and it was always clean. Very comfortable. The WI-FI didn't work in our room on the first floor though, so we had to sit in the lobby anytime we wanted to use it. Staff were friendly, but we were charged the tourist tax when we checked out, as apparently it was only recently brought in, after we had booked. Th staff did not mention this to us, or that we would have to pay it, until the very moment we checked out. I thought this was a bit slack. The breakfast room was very nice and clean, and there was a good choice of breakfast foods. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyingsolo2007
Reviews.Content: This is quite a small hotel which has been decorated to a relatively high standard. The room I had was big enough to fit in a good sized double bed, but this meant a bit of a squeeze getting around the room. I was travelling on my own and so using a double for single use. It would have been very cosy for two people. Fortunately there was a very efficient air conditioning system and pleasant shower room. These were essential as this August (2011) it was very hot, between 35C and 38C. I was having three showers a day! Also pleasant if limited breakfast room. Also take a good map to find it in the first place as it is down a rather narrow alley which opens into a small square with the hotel on a corner. When I arrived the locals were having a get together with tables outside in the square and a slide show followed by a sing-along. Fun to watch when passing by and gave a very local feel quite different from the main island. Giudecca itself is rather limited for restauarants and a couple are quite pricey for what you get. My peference was the Trattoria al Cacciatorri. However, note that these waterside restaurants have little in the way of architectural delights to set them off and when busy they can appear rushed. I had my last nights slap up meal further down at the Hilton Stucky Hotel restaurant which was splendid but inevitably expensive. But what the hell! You're on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel . will be back”
Reviews.Author: PABLO K
Reviews.Content: for those who do not need to be in the middle of the noise and crowed Venice, but to enjoy real local life and travelling to central Venice with the Vaporetto, commuting boat. Very nice and refurbish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and excellent value hotel with aloof front desk gentlemen”
Reviews.Author: SFKevin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean, and the room was spacious with views of the water. The front desk gentlemen were not friendly and made us feel uncomfortable when asking questions about Venice. I would stay here again but I hope the customer service improves because I would have given this hotel 5 stars. The hotel breakfast was delicious and I enjoyed riding the water taxis and the water buses. The hotel is a short distance away from the city center and I enjoyed the hotel's location. It was nice to sleep in a quiet area. Make sure to go on a gondola ride; it was so much fun and the views of Venice were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel, well placed and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Anthoncorinne
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel with some canal view rooms. The reception desk is very friendly and likes to help. Hotel near palanca vaporetto station and only 5 to 10 mintues from San Marco. Very quiet place, not that easy to find the firts time ... when Palanca is on your back, turn left and cross a small bridge, first street (very small) on your right, walk 100 meters and the entrance is on the right just before a wooden bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice”
Reviews.Author: Kulda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and really loved the place. The room was clean and spacious , our bathroom would match 4-stars ranking without hesitation. The staff was friendly and we also enjoyednice breakfast, although it did not offered any hot meal like fried bacon or scrambled eggs. Free Wi-Fi was another pleasant surprise, however signal in our room on ground floor was very poor. The location on Guidecca island is not a problem, since you take vaporeto lines 2, 41 or 42 to explore the rest of Venice (48-hour vapporeto pass is highly recommended for 28EUR). As a benefit of this a bit remote location you will get nice panorama of Venice every morning and evening while stroling along Guidecca waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great value, will return.”
Reviews.Author: snowNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Palanca stop (Giudecca canal), in a residential area where real Venetians live, go to school, dock their boats, walk their pets, and it's blessedly quiet. Although a small hotel, the rooms are spacious, well lit, with large enough bathrooms, and full-height openable windows. Beds and linens are very comfortable--we slept well. The place is spotless, the air conditioning controllable and quiet. The young staff are outgoing and helpful and will offer to do extra things for you. The breakfast was great, although some real protein (how about hard-boiled eggs?--simple) would be very welcome. Otherwise, cheese, ham, cereal, good yoghurt, good fresh fruit, great breakfast "tortes." The breakfast room has a translucent roof and walls that provide a bright, pleasant setting. One thing: PLEASE serve fresh coffee! There are inexpensive hotels in Venice that make fresh espresso for every guest every morning. Automatic coffee machines just don't cut it. More expensive rooms have views of a canal; cheaper ones overlook the breakfast room room but also trees in neighbouring yards, with birdsong. Overall, my most pleasant and restful stay in Venice. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and lovely hotel near Venice”
Reviews.Author: emileeetravels
Reviews.Content: We were surprised that this hotel was only 3 stars, since it was cleaner and newer than some 4 star hotels we've been to in Italy. The staff is lovely and friendly. The only slight downside is that the location is not the most ideal - you have to take the Vaporetto to see the sights, which isn't too inconvenient except that the Vaporetto is quite pricey and it's still a bit annoying to be dependent on a water bus to get around. Still this hotel was affordable (by Venice standards) so we were okay with the inconvenience of taking the Vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Nonexistent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Annabanana86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May. The reception was very unwelcoming while we were there but the icing in the cake was after we left. My boyfriend left his jacket behind (I know our fault, we rushed out). I called the hotel the following day to give them my CC# to ship the jacket (a very common practice in hotels- people (morons like us) leave things behind all the time.) The hotel refused to do anything to help us. They literally said you deal with it. I don't speak Italian nor am I familiar with any shipping services in Venice. Fortunately the concierge at our next hotel was nice enough to call a friend in venice and have them take care of shipping. It was totally ridiculous that Domina Home would do nothing to help. The hotel itself is average and I have no complaints about the rooms but I definitely don't recommend staying in a place where they are too lazy to help out their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: SSY0202
Reviews.Content: We were initially concerned about staying in Giudecca, but found this to be the perfect location. The hotel is in the less touristy part of Venice, which is nice when you want to escape from the crowds. It's close to Coop (the local supermarket). We stopped there practically every morning to pick up groceries. The hotel is also close to some nice restaurants. We found the hotel to be very clean and nice. The staff was also very friendly. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the crowds, yet close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: anjarella
Reviews.Content: We just loved staying on Giudecca island - it's close to the centre (just a couple of stops on the vaporetto) yet away from all the tourists that make Venice not that enjoyable... The hotel is nice and in a quiet back street not far away from the vaporetto stop - and a couple of nice bars and restaurants by the giudecca canal from which you can see the main island of Venice. The room was nice and cosy and had a decent size - also the bathroom. Breakfast was quite extensive for Italian standards (which are very basic) but if you want a true Italian coffee go and have breakfast at one of the little tables outside the little snack bar by the giudecca canal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: syzygy65
Reviews.Content: I was here as a single traveller to take photos for a week. The hotel was well reviewed and did not disappoint. Great location near the vaporetto stop - 5 mins from St.Marks, etc. I bought a weeks pass and used it every day - great value, (about 50 euros). Room big and clean and nicely furnished, looked onto the canal, king size bed, good shower, (no bath but that was what I asked for). Internet in the lobby only but this gives you a chance to chat to the staff who were very friendly and helpful. If you get back and cannot be bothered eating out there is a local pizza shop does great pizza only a few minutes walk and you can sit there or take it back. I took advantage of a special offer re the minibar and got everything for 15 euros which was good. Room safe which is good but not laptop size - ipad probably ok. Breakfast was the usual but nice and sometimes I just skipped it to grab early morning vaporetto to grab some photos before the (other) tourists got up! Overall a great experience and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: annekendall20
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. It was situated on the corner of a peaceful little square only a short walk from the vaporetto stop and very easy to find. our room was tastefully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpfull . The breakfasts were varied and plentiful though we would have preferred fresh coffee. There were several good restaurants nearby to eat at in the evening. This was our first visit to Venice and we stayed aweek and were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: RoRodriguez
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is not in the mainland of Venice, it was so close and easy to get to the mainland. It was only a 5 mins ride in the waterbus. Great value!! How to get to the hotel: Vaporetto #2 to Palaca, walk to left and turn right in the first alley after the little bridge.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and practical hotel for anyone with a limited budget”
Reviews.Author: MBS1925
Reviews.Content: I looked for a small cost-efficient and very clean hotel for one night in Venice, away from the milling crowd but close to a waterbus stop. The reception sent me clear instruction how to get there from the airport. It is 5 minutes walk from nearest waterbus stop. The room was clean with a refrigerate bar. The room telephone was not working well, but with a mobile this was not a real problem. Pleasant receptionist who then made internet arrangement for return flight. There is a self-service breakfast arrangement with a good selection of food and beverage. Although there are plenty of small local restaurants on Giudecca, the two I sampled were of indifferent quality.

Reviews.Title: “very rude male at reception”
Reviews.Author: dakimelan
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband, arrived late at night around 10pm, was tired and looking forward to my arrival to the hotel, however when we arrived we were greeted by a very unfriendly man behind the reception desk, he was so rude that i spent two hours in our room very upset and hated having to pass him as he dirty eyed me up and down as i passed making my stay sum what uncomfortable. having said that the female receptionist was lovely and very helpful. they hotel was gorgeous and very clean. the location was ideal. restaurants were cheap and the super market was and ideal place to pick up snacks. the breakfast is very pleasant and light, consisting of cereals, salamis, yoghurt and fruit. keeps you full till lunch. also on the day we were due to depart, there was a heavy rain storm, our room leaked really bad and soaked our bed. when we told they guy at reception he did not even say sorry. just said ok and shot a dirty look. so try to visit in may/june when there are no thunder storms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great price.... GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: David_Avery
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the hotel and it was all I remembered and more. It is down a narrow walkway and you wouldn't believe a gem of a hotel could be found down there. The gentleman on reception when we arrived couldn't have been more helpful. He suggested restaurants and gave us travel information for the next day. The rooms are lovely, clean and warm. We opted for the canal view, but you don't get much of a view. The breakfast was fine - cereals, juices, pastries, ham and cheese. The waitress was lovely. Times are good too - 7.30am to 10.30am. The only complaint I would have is the shower cubicle in the bathroom is a little on the small side. That aside, the shower was hot and powerful. The hotel is really quiet and if it wasn't for the sound of church bells we would still be asleep at 10am each day. The hotel is just a few hundred metres from the Palanca vaporetto stop. From here you can reach the main island easily and quickly. Great hotel and would recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quaint and wonderful sums up our stay at this little jewel of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: BMWalsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights before boarding a cruise ship and were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The location and the room were both beyond our expectations for the cost. The water taxi's were dependable, timely and efficient. Getting around was no issue even in the rain! Great places to eat nearby and directly across the canal. The staff were WONDERFUL!!! Very helpful, courteous, and language never a problem. Breakfasts served in very pleasant atmosphere and plenty of choices. Glad we stumbled upon thise very quaint inn....would definitely recommend to all and return to same if travelling Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would definately go back when next in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: summersgal
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem, away from the hustle and bustle of St.Marks but so easy and quick on the Vaporetto to head back there, and what a magical ride it is (my friend and i could have ridden them all day!!) As an International flight attendant I think i am a pretty good expert on hotels and this did not let me down. Almost brand new the rooms were absolutley lovely, we had a twin room which was more than big enough for two girls on a quick two day visit. Bathroom was large very modern and immaculatley clean, shower was a little small perhaps by American standards but this is EUROPE!! The Continental breakfast was again a delight, cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, ham and cheese and various breads and spreads had us full way past lunch time. A do it yourself coffee machine and yummy juice machine had us going back for more.The breakfast room was bright and clean and a lovely place to start the day. Americans may express their dissapointment but this is not IHOP it's Europe!! Directions are easy too... get off the Vaporetto number 2 or 41/42 at the stop called 'PALANCA' depending which way you are coming from will determine which one you get. Once off the boat turn LEFT go over the first bridge and after about 4 shops you will see a barbers shop on your right, TURN HERE it looks like a tiny little alley way but this is the right way! Keep walking through the alley way until you get to the little square, the hotel is next to the Canal on the right (they should have a sign out the front so you can't miss it!!) Print these directions out and take it with you and i guarantee you won't get lost. Apart rom that my top tips would be to dine around the Palanca Vaporetto stop. The restaurants are lovely and cheaper than in Venice and you can enjoy having the perspective of looking back on the city from the other side. Dining along the water front at sunset was magical and there was often a big cruise ship sailing past which made a wonderful photo opportunity. Also if you can't aford the extortionate cost of a Gondola ride take the number 1 Vaporetto up and down the Grand Canal, if you can grab a seat out the front it is truly an amazing ride..get your camera ready!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gret location, price, staff, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JakeInNYC
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, a 2 minute vaparetto ride away from the hustle and bustle. We felt like locals eating at places were mainly Italian was spoken, the food was good, and the prices were reasonable. As has been said, definitely get the multiday water bus ticket. Water taxi would have run us 100 Euro, bus to the city was 3 Euro and 72 hour vaparetto pass was 30 Euro, it was easy and still exciting and novel. Staff spoke excellent english, were very helpful. Breakfast was ample and good. Had no noise complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: cokaboka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot and are always looking for a nice, clean place, centrally located, but reasonably priced. This hotel has all these qualities and more. We have heard horror stories about Venetian hospitality, so we were really pleasantly surprised. The stuff in this hotel was pleasant and very helpful. The breakfast was very nice. There was absolutely nothing negative about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Festival of the Feasts”
Reviews.Author: Annalise_Andy_UK
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you're heading for the Festival of the Feasts - last weekend of July. Just far enough away from St Marcs to benefit from cheaper prices - good breakfasts, small compact rooms and a lovely foyet looking over the canal. A great place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great rooms & breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: bkg2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a weekend trip to Venice for Carnevale. The inside of the hotel is very nice and we thought that the rooms were great. We had a little bit of trouble finding the hotel because the directions from the website were not so clear. Staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. A nice breakfast is included. Location is not too bad, although it would be ideal to stay somewhere in the center of Venice. For the price, however, this may be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “So beautifull!”
Reviews.Author: jack_sparrow962
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and clean! And the staff is terrific! The hotel is very well located and my Wife and I will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a truly romantic break”
Reviews.Author: ScottishBella
Reviews.Content: Venice is busy, loud and full of tourists - if you want to escape all that but still have a truly Venetian (and romantic!) break in Venice then go to this hotel. It is situated just across the water from the mainland and it is so peaceful and tranquil. Most of the rooms look over a canal, are very clean and reasonably priced for what you are getting. Mini-bar in room, air-conditioning, bar in hotel, free internet access in hotel lobby, helpful staff. I love this hotel. Even better that just a three minute walk and you've got a perfect little spot for sunbathing and looking over the ocean. Beautiful! Getting to the hotel is really easy - take the number 2 or 42 waterbus to Giudecca Palanca (only about 4 stops away) from the train station. From that stop, take a left, go over the bridge, and its the first right, down at the bottom of the small walkway. So simple to find, rather than getting lost in the maze of streets on the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: BadHabits
Reviews.Content: This small hotel far exceeded our expectations. A peaceful haven a short water bus ride from the the hustle and bustle of St Marks Square. Comfortable, well furnished rooms, helpful and friendly staff, quiet location - though not easy to find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for Exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Ideal location good value for money. Clean and 600 metres from water buses. Quiet and away from the main part of venice but easy connections via the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: JdeP
Reviews.Content: Location: hard to find if you don't have good directions. Read other reviews for advice. Once you are there it is very peaceful and quiet. Getting to the other islands is both quick and a very pleasant way to start the day. At the end of the day you can escape the crowds and noise. There was a vaporetto (water-bus) strike one day we were there, but plenty of ferries run when there is a strike, so it was not an inconvenience. Rooms: I went with two friends so I saw three rooms; one was big (no. 207, twin beds), one small (103, I think, single bed), and one middling (205, double bed). Maybe it's just the luck of the draw, but if you arrive early enough it may be worth asking if a larger room is available. The higher up you are, the quieter it will be. The rooms and bathrooms were all recently renovated, clean, and well-equipped (good shower, hair-drier, heated towel-rack, etc.) Room facilities: the TV/internet thing didn't work well, but I don't go on holiday to watch TV or read email. Take a book about Venice to read instead. Breakfast: buffet with plenty to choose from (cereal, yoghurt, breads, jams, croissants, fruit, milk, fruit-juice, ...), in a pleasant light, airy room. Reception desk: all the staff speak English reasonably well or very well, and were helpful. Value for money: I booked through Hotels.com and got a rate less than half the price being asked by some other websites. Get a 24- or 48- or 72-hour water-bus pass and you will save lots of money and time.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: KayH21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January and it was being renovated at the tme - this did not deter from the lovel welcome and fab waiting staff at breakfast - which was plentiful (the coffee was hot and milky - gorgeous) The rooms were spotless. It was fantastic to travel on the water bus every day to get to the main tourist spots of Venice nd just as nice to travel back at night to get away from the hustle and bustle and have some peace and tranquility on Guidecca.

Reviews.Title: “Ditch the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: mlpfromfla
Reviews.Content: The Domina Giudecca is a quaint and cozy hotel just outside of Venice. It is easy to find if you follow the instructions from previous visitors! It takes about 25 minutes to get to the hotel from the train station on Vaporetto #82. Get off at the Palanca stop, go to the left as you exit and follow the the sidewalk along the water. Go over the bridge and as stated before look for the barber shop and it is the next alleyway on your right. Follow the alleyway all the way down to the next bridge and you will see the hotel on the right. Once you get there you will see that it was worth the trip. The hotel is beautiful on the inside and the staff at the desk are nice. The rooms are updated and very cozy. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom has hot water and good water pressure. The breakfast in the morning has more than enough items to get you off to a good start for the day! Although we read that getting around Venice was tough we found it to be the easiest of all the cities we visited. Be sure to buy a water taxi pass for the number of days you'll be in Venice! This is by far the best way to go if you plan on visiting Murano, Burano(beautiful!), or San Michelle. While in Venice, the signs will always lead you to the Rialto Bridge or St Mark's Square so it's hard to get lost. If you do get lost, hey, it's an island so you're bound to hit water(and a water taxi) at some point so don't sweat it! And at the end of the day the best part was heading back to Giudecca for some great pizza at La Foca and a great night's sleep at Domina Giudecca!

Reviews.Title: “go to giudecca”
Reviews.Author: TopTrump
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, tucked away on the Island of Giudecca. Offers a great escape from the main island of venice and offers a glimpse into life there without the tourists. Great to get the vapparettos every day across to the main island, really helps get the feel of the city. apparently Giudecca is on the up, with new hilton hotel being planned - so go quickly and enjoy it while you can

Reviews.Title: “Anna- Thank you!!!”
Reviews.Author: dreboyd
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room in this hotel. It was clean and a great location, away from the center of town. It reminded me of a room on a nice cruise ship. Our bag did not arrive, and there was a staff member there named Anna, who is really just incredible- so helpful and nice. Thank you Anna!! OH- If you are going to eat dinner on Giudecca, make sure to eat dinner early, when there are tables. We could not get a table, but ended up eating great pizza at a place along the water!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anacosta25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and I recomend it to everybody. Its only minutes away from st. Marks' Square. Me and my husband stayed at room 104 ita a medium sized room but has everything you need. only the english channels were not working. The breakfast was really filling and near the hotel you have a good choise of restaurants to eat and it can be really cheaper. I recomend Redentor near the Redentore Vaporeto Stop, Do Mori just after Palanca Stop. I had a fantastic week there and next year i will be back in Venice and i will be staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTrav1984
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Domina Prestige. Its location on La Giudecca is free of the crowds of tourists to be found on San Marco, but it is only ten minutes by water bus. I stayed in a single room, number 13, which I found to be clean and modern. In general, I found the hotel to be excellent value - it is comparitvely inexpensive for Venice. I bought a seven day pass for the vaporetti at the airport, which proved a good investment, as one must travel off La Giudecca for most of Venice's tourist attractions. There are several restaurants and bars near to the hotel, although the choice is not so extensive as the more tourist dominated areas of the city. I recommend Ristorante Mistra, which is located in an upper floor of a warehouse on the southern side of the island. Its location is signposted on the fondementa between Palanca and Redentore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that made this a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: gostling
Reviews.Content: We had three very comfortable nights at this hotel. It takes a bit of finding but is worth the effort. We had one of the superior rooms. It cost us a total 515 Euros for our stay. The room was a reasonable size, well appointed and very clean. The air conditioning worked well. My only minor grumble was that neither of the 2 english language channels on the TV (BBC and CNN) worked. The staff speak good english and are very pleasent to deal with. The continental buffet breakfast is excellent. Finding the hotel was a bit of a challenge. The way I would give directions is to get off the waterbus at Palanca, stepping off the dock turn left (East) along the promenade and walk about one hundred yards until you cross a little bridge. As soon as you have crossed the bridge look for narrow allyway on your right. Go down this alleyway and you come to an open courtyard with an old well in the middle. Continue across the courtyard and you will see the Hotel entance on your right. Hopefully there will also be a sign standing on the pavement outside to help you find the door. Being on one of the southern islands in the lagoon puts this hotel in a quiet location. For us this was in welcome contrast to the busy main attractions of Venice. However, you are only a short walk from the Waterbus stop, and a frequent service will get you to San Marco in about 10 minutes. There are several restaurants nearby. We went to the Do Mori twice. It is just by the waterbus stop with friendly staff serving good quality food in an informal atmosphere at a sensible prices. Venice is an amazing and friendly city. We really enjoyed our stay there and this hotel turned out to be the ideal choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting trip...”
Reviews.Author: gem8384
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Domina Prestige, Giudecca, Venice. We arrived on a Ryanair flight from Stansted mid afternoon, following a two hour flight delay and were understandably a little tired! Having never visited Venice before- we selected to fly into Treviso airport and were a little suprised at the distance from Venice itself, being approximately an hour away. The options for travel to the hotel were either a private water taxi, provided by the hotel at a cost of 70 Euros (one way!!) or a coach to Plaza la Roma and a water bus from there. The latter is far more stressful amd takes a very long time but only costs 11 Euros each- significantly cheaper! We decided upon the cheaper option! A single fare on the coach is 5 Euros each but a return is 9 Euros- so makes sense to do that! Also buy the ticket before you leave the Airport as they don't sell them on the coach and we missed the first coach as we hadn't realised that! The coach ride was air conditioned and comfortable so not bad at all! Upon arrival at Plaza la Roma, we boarded a water bus which was the number 82 to Palanca (the nearest stop to the hotel). There are numerous options for tickets but the cheapest way is to buy one for the duration we were there- wish we had realised that at the beginning!! And a 72 hour ticket costs 30 Euros, a 48 hour costs 25 Euros and a 24 hour 15 Euros. There is also the option of a single fare which is only 6 Euros- but lasts for 12 hours. You can also buy these at the Tabac stores (there is one by the Palanca stop) and I am told these are cheaper- but didn't find this out until I got back! I have read many reviews on bus routes but we used the 82 in all directions and it was the most direct and easiest. You can also buy single tickets from the guys on the boat but don't forget once you get on as the signs warned of hefty fines. We were only asked to show our tickets once though and that was on the way out- little suprising since we used the service about 20 times! When you arrive at the Palanca you need to turn left off the jetty and head towards a little bridge that you will see ahead, walk over the bridge and there is a little alley way almost immediately on your right hand side. It's very narrow so be careful with suitcases or large umbrellas! Walk right to the end and up ahead you will see another little bridge. The Domina is the last door on the right and there should be a little sign outside the door telling you you are in the right place! The receptionist was initially very welcoming and we were allocated room 12. Following reading a review of the hotel we were warned that room 12 was not recommended due to its proximity to the bar and reception and became quite noisy at times. We returned to reception to explain and ask if there were any other rooms available- and the receptionist became quite snotty and wouldn't even look me in the eye. I don't have the loudest of voices and my boyfriend told me afterwards that he could hear everything we said- word perfectly so it was certainly the right decision to move! We ended up in room 9 after a lot of faffing about! The rooms are ALOT smaller than you would expect but modern, clean and well furnished. The bathroom was a good size with a fabulous shower and you a provided with a great selection of little toiletries, bath robes and slippers! In room facilities included an lcd tv and wireless keyboard for internet access. Be warned though EVERYthing on telly is italian (as you'd expect!), I think we were a little naive in hoping somehting would be in English and next time I think I would bring a laptop and some dvds so as to relax comfortably after a long day marching around the streets of Venice! Breakfast was basic but nice, a selection of breads, cold meat, cheese, yoghurt, cereal and juices are provided. A good start to the day! Overall we had a good trip but found it to be very expensive (We spent about Â£400 between us, just on food and travel around Venice and we didn't even buy anything! We found the majority of people polite but not overly friendly! The staff at the hotel were pleasant but we only met two that appeared to understand the concept of customer service! Bit of a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Sab42
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three day break in Venice, staying at The Domina Prestige Hotel. Arrived by water taxi from Marco Polo airport, which was fantastic! The hotel has it's own mooring. The staff were polite and friendly and spoke very good English. The rooms were ready even though we arrived early. Our rooms were on the 2nd floor overlooking the canal (although you would need to be less than 3ft to look out the window!) Although small, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean and modern. Very nice breakfast, with freshly baked croissants. We purchased a 3day Vaparetto (water bus) pass, at the airport, for 30 Euros each, which enables you to travel to any part of Venice on the water bus. From Giudecca it takes less than 5 mins to the mainland or 15 mins to San Marco. The weather was exremely hot and May is a very busy time of year to visit Venice. We found after spending an exhausting day visiting all the sights in Venice it was lovely to return to the much quiter and more peaceful island of Giudecca. I highly recommend The Palanca Bar (near The Palanca Water Bus stop) - a nice place for lunch or a drink with the locals! This was my third visit to Venice and my best............I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Giudecca Island”
Reviews.Author: KevinTurvey
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to Venice. Previously stayed in the main tourist areas,first time at a dreadful place, seond time at Ca Angeli on the Grand Canal and now on Giudecca Island. Arrived at Treviso airport with Ryanair. A unique experience in that we will never do it again. A slow bus ride to the Piazzale Roma took well over anhour stopping at Mestre en route. If you visit Venice, fly to Marco Polo and take a water taxi straight to your hotel It is expensive but is a memory that you will keep with you. Best to buy a â‚¬25 two day pass for the Vaparetto water buses. Then you can hop on and off to you heart's content, it is all part of the magic of Venice. The 42 is the quik boat to Palanca for the Domina Hotel. The 82 is slower - take your pick. From Palanca walk a few metresEast along the waterside and then take one of two narrow streets to your right. The one with the arched top is the second and wider option - watch out for dogs' mess they love their little dogs in Venice!!! A friendly local guessed we were looking for the Domina and directed us. As buildings are not allowed to fix name noards to their frontage (thank goodness 'cos it would ruin the cuty) it can be tricky to spot your hotel. The Domina is just before your cross a bridge over the canal and is to your right. There is a pavement sign. The hotel receptionist was welcoming (part of the job that sometimes gets forgotten). Our rooms were not like those on this website but perfectly OK and good value. Everything worked fine. There is internet ata price and a mini bar. TV channels are limited but what the heck, Venice is outside. We had chosen Giudecca to save a few euros as we were picking up the tab for two rooms. Having stayed there I will return as it is quieter, has many more locals, some ordinary shops and pleasant eateries. Hop on the boat for Venice and the Lido. Breakfast in the hotel was good. Would certainly return and would try to get a bigger room. During our stay they asked us if we would move into a room for four as they had overbooked. We declined but felt they should not have asked. Strolled along Giudecca and found an even better hotel. It is called the Cipriani. Would like to stay there but room cost up to â‚¬8,000 per night. yes eight thousand.

Reviews.Title: “Great break”
Reviews.Author: Throstle
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 night break at this hotel and really enjouyed our stay. The hotel is fairly basic but perfect for Venice because you won't be there much. Loveley room on the corner with canal views and a great complimentary breakfast included. Location is fine and easily accessible by water bus. We arrived by water taxi initially and it may be difficult to find for the first time if you don't use this service which delivers you right to the door. We would definitely stay again - excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt's-Buddy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here mid March. We arrived at 11pm and the receptionist could not have been more welcoming, she had a very good grasp of English too. The hotel itself is situated in a residential area and is away from the main tourist spots. This was an advantage. The hotel looked relatively new with lovely clean facilities and fresh towels every day. Buffet breakfast was very good. Water bus ticket is a must (25 euros for a two day ticket) so that you can travel the grande canal. The sights were amasing along the way. It is only 10 minutes on the water bus to the St Marco Square where everyone seems to head. Venice itself was truely wonderful, lots of little cafe's and eateries. Would highly recommend the fresh fish market, amasing. Venice is very quiet at night, very little to do. Would definately go back to Venice and would certainly stay at the Domina, perfect location, very friendly staff and good breakfast to start your day on. The only piece of advice I might give is to try to book a second floor room as the ground floor rooms are partially below ground and not so well laid out. Take comfortable shoes with you as you will do a lot of walking!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Vespavanti
Reviews.Content: Giudecca is a good (although somewhat remote) base to explore Venice. There are two or three good restaurants near the hotel. We liked especially the "Redentore" next to the vaporetto stop bearing the same name. Rooms in the hotels are small (this is Venice...) but comfortable and very clean. If you want to go to a nice-tasty restaurant across the Laguna, we recommend "la Piscina". This is more expensive, though. From the Palacanca Vaporetto stop, take the 82 Vaporetto and get off at the (next) "Zattere" stop. Coming from the train or bus stations, it is preferable to take the 82 or 42 vaporettos (as opposed to the combination of 1 and 42 referred in another review. You will save 30 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Good service affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Invitada
Reviews.Content: I would recomend the hotel. The service was very professional and helpful. Breakfast really good (american breakfast). I also agree with the other comments, print for the address references given in a previous message it was really helpful for us. Just one thing: if you don't speak italian don't waste your monery paying for the cable TV. All the programms are Italian spoken!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Lies and Steals”
Reviews.Author: OlafProt
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler in Europe for 15 years, and be warned that the management staff at this hotel will lie and steal from you in the form of overpriced taxi service. The going rate for water taxi service is 90.00 EURO per hour in Venic, the hotel staff insists on booking taxis for you and charging 120.00 EURO per hour. During my stay we booked a taxi for 4-6 hour excursion, and were told by the staff that it was 120.00 per hour and a minimum of 6 hours (and had to be paid in cash), when the taxi arrived he stated that it should have been 90.00 per hour and that there was no minimum hourly charge (he owned his own taxi). We decided to book this same taxi driver directly for our departure the next day for 60 EURO, and in the morning the staff called 30 minutes before to tell us that our driver cancelled and that they would find a new taxi for me - but it would be 90 EURO in cash. This was not true, as our taxi arrived on time and said he never called to cancel. I contacted the Domina hotel chain after I returned from Italy and demanded my money back, which they agreed to do - which shows me that this is not the first time they have done this to their guests, nor will it be the last until the management is replaced. Be warned if you stay here not to trust the management staff!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the reception”
Reviews.Author: Abyron
Reviews.Content: The directions i printed from a previous travel advisor enabled us to find the hotel without a problem, so i would advise to do the same because it is hidden away. The rooms are clean and good value for money although there double bed was actualy two pushed together. We didnt find the fact it was on a seperate Island to much of a hindrance although at times it would have been nice just to walk back to the hotel it was good to see how the natives live. The breakfast on the first day was pretty much none existent, after that we presumed someone had complained and the following two were fine. Our only real fault with the hotel was the staff on reception. when we first arrived we were greeted by a chap who barely bothered to look at us, when we asked a question the best we could get out of him was yes and no answers. the second day when we asked him to book a restraunt he told us to do it from our room, when this didnt work we called him and when we told him the problem he huffed and put the phone down. Fortunatly we are a very laid back couple and didnt really let this get to us but it did make us feel very unwelcome. Saying that though Venice is a wonderfull place and im sure wherever you stay you will have a cracking time. enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “No compliants!”
Reviews.Author: N.Davies
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. Small, clean, economical and convenient to vaporetta stop to take you into Venice. Enjoyed our stay, would recommend. No compliants.

HotelInfo.Name: Domina Home Giudecca
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Ferrando 409 | Giudecca, 30100 Venice, Italy
